quotes.author: Averroes
quotes.quote: Ignorance leads to fear, fear leads to hate, and hate leads to violence.
quotes.meaning: Lack of knowledge creates chain reaction toward harm.

quotes.author: Maimonides
quotes.quote: Teach thy tongue to say 'I do not know,' and thou shalt progress.

quotes.author: Thomas More
quotes.quote: A man who has not passed through the inferno of his passions has never overcome them.

quotes.author: Erasmus
quotes.quote: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.

quotes.author: Giordano Bruno
quotes.quote: It is proof of a base and low mind for one to wish to think with the masses or majority.

quotes.author: Paracelsus
quotes.quote: Thoughts are free and are subject to no rule.

quotes.author: Copernicus
quotes.quote: To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.

quotes.author: Tycho Brahe
quotes.quote: Let me not seem to have lived in vain.

quotes.author: Girolamo Cardano
quotes.quote: The greatest advantage I know of being thought a magician is that it is a shield.

quotes.author: Andreas Vesalius
quotes.quote: I am not accustomed to saying anything with certainty after only one or two observations.

quotes.author: William Gilbert
quotes.quote: In the discovery of secret things and in the investigation of hidden causes, stronger reasons are obtained from sure experiments than from probable conjectures.

quotes.author: Simon Stevin
quotes.quote: Wonder is no wonder.

quotes.author: William Harvey
quotes.quote: Nature is nowhere accustomed more openly to display her secret mysteries than in cases where she shows traces of her workings apart from the beaten path.

quotes.author: Christiaan Huygens
quotes.quote: The world is my country, science is my religion.

quotes.author: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz
quotes.quote: When God calculates and exercises his cogitation, the world is made.

quotes.author: Robert Hooke
quotes.quote: The truth is, the science of Nature has been already too long made only a work of the brain and the fancy.

quotes.author: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek
quotes.quote: My work, which I've done for a long time, was not pursued in order to gain the praise I now enjoy, but chiefly from a craving after knowledge.

quotes.author: Edmond Halley
quotes.quote: This sight... is by far the noblest astronomy affords.

quotes.author: Daniel Bernoulli
quotes.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.

quotes.author: Leonhard Euler
quotes.quote: Although to penetrate into the intimate mysteries of nature and thence to learn the true causes of phenomena is not allowed to us, nevertheless it can happen that a certain fictive hypothesis may suffice for explaining many phenomena.
quotes.meaning: Useful models need not represent ultimate reality.

quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.quote: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

quotes.author: Joseph Priestley
quotes.quote: Every man, when he comes to be sensible of his natural rights, and to feel his own importance, will scorn to submit to any thing less than full and complete equality.

quotes.author: Henry Cavendish
quotes.quote: Truth is always more than it seems.

quotes.author: Alessandro Volta
quotes.quote: The language of experiment is more authoritative than any reasoning.

quotes.author: André-Marie Ampère
quotes.quote: The future science of government should be called 'la science sociale.'

quotes.author: Joseph Fourier
quotes.quote: Nature is an inexhaustible source of new questions.

quotes.author: Augustin-Louis Cauchy
quotes.quote: Men pass away, but their deeds abide.

quotes.author: Évariste Galois
quotes.quote: I have not time.

quotes.author: George Boole
quotes.quote: No matter how correct a mathematical theorem may appear to be, one ought never to be satisfied that there was not something imperfect about it until it also gives the impression of being beautiful.

quotes.author: Augusta Ada King
quotes.quote: That brain of mine is something more than merely mortal; as time will show.

quotes.author: Charles Babbage
quotes.quote: Errors using inadequate data are much less than those using no data at all.

quotes.author: Lord Kelvin
quotes.quote: When you can measure what you are speaking about, and express it in numbers, you know something about it.

quotes.author: James Prescott Joule
quotes.quote: It is evident that an acquaintance with natural laws means no less than an acquaintance with the mind of God.

quotes.author: Hermann von Helmholtz
quotes.quote: Whoever wants to see and hear, one must not be wholly unprepared.

quotes.author: Rudolf Clausius
quotes.quote: The energy of the universe is constant. The entropy of the universe tends to a maximum.

quotes.author: James Clerk Maxwell
quotes.quote: Science is incompetent to reason upon the creation of matter itself out of nothing.

quotes.author: Georg Cantor
quotes.quote: In mathematics, the art of proposing a question must be held of higher value than solving it.

quotes.author: Wilhelm Röntgen
quotes.quote: I did not think; I investigated.

quotes.author: Henri Becquerel
quotes.quote: One must not think slightingly of the paradoxical.

quotes.author: J.J. Thomson
quotes.quote: From the point of view of the physicist, a theory of matter is a policy rather than a creed.

quotes.author: Ernest Rutherford
quotes.quote: If your experiment needs statistics, you ought to have done a better experiment.
quotes.meaning: Clear effects don't require statistical analysis.

quotes.author: Niels Bohr
quotes.quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.

quotes.author: Max Born
quotes.quote: The belief that there is only one truth and that oneself is in possession of it seems to me the deepest root of all evil.

quotes.author: Wolfgang Pauli
quotes.quote: There is no quantum world. There is only an abstract quantum physical description.

quotes.author: Louis de Broglie
quotes.quote: The actual state of our knowledge is always provisional.

quotes.author: Enrico Fermi
quotes.quote: There are two possible outcomes: if the result confirms the hypothesis, then you've made a measurement. If the result is contrary to the hypothesis, then you've made a discovery.
quotes.meaning: Both confirming and refuting yield value.

quotes.author: Lise Meitner
quotes.quote: Science makes people reach selflessly for truth and objectivity; it teaches people to accept reality, with wonder and admiration.

quotes.author: Otto Hahn
quotes.quote: Certainty of death, uncertainty of the hour.

quotes.author: Chien-Shiung Wu
quotes.quote: There is only one thing worse than coming home from the lab to a sink full of dirty dishes, and that is not going to the lab at all.

quotes.author: Richard Feynman
quotes.quote: Nature uses only the longest threads to weave her patterns, so that each small piece of her fabric reveals the organization of the entire tapestry.

quotes.author: Murray Gell-Mann
quotes.quote: Everything not forbidden is compulsory.
quotes.meaning: Physical law permits all non-prohibited phenomena.

quotes.author: Sheldon Glashow
quotes.quote: We are the children of the universe; we are made of star stuff.
quotes.meaning: Human matter originates from stellar processes.

quotes.author: Steven Weinberg
quotes.quote: With or without religion, good people can behave well and bad people can do evil; but for good people to do evil - that takes religion.

quotes.author: Abdus Salam
quotes.quote: Scientific thought and its creation is the common and shared heritage of mankind.

quotes.author: Andrei Sakharov
quotes.quote: Science demands from a man all his life.

quotes.author: Ilya Prigogine
quotes.quote: The future is uncertain... but this uncertainty is at the very heart of human creativity.

quotes.author: Benoit Mandelbrot
quotes.quote: Bottomless wonders spring from simple rules, which are repeated without end.

quotes.author: Stephen Jay Gould
quotes.quote: Science is not a heartless pursuit of objective information. It is a creative human activity.
quotes.meaning: Research involves emotional and imaginative engagement.

quotes.author: Lynn Margulis
quotes.quote: Life on Earth is such a good story that it must be told.

quotes.author: Carl Woese
quotes.quote: The phylogenetic concept is no longer an empty abstraction.

quotes.author: James Lovelock
quotes.quote: The Earth is a living organism.

quotes.author: E.O. Wilson
quotes.quote: Destroying rainforest for economic gain is like burning a Renaissance painting to cook a meal.

quotes.author: Jane Goodall
quotes.quote: Only if we understand, will we care. Only if we care, will we help.
quotes.meaning: Knowledge enables emotional engagement and action.

quotes.author: Rachel Carson
quotes.quote: The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.

quotes.author: Dian Fossey
quotes.quote: When you realize the value of all life, you dwell less on what is past and concentrate more on the preservation of the future.

quotes.author: Sylvia Earle
quotes.quote: No water, no life. No blue, no green.

quotes.author: Jacques Cousteau
quotes.quote: The sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever.

quotes.author: David Attenborough
quotes.quote: An understanding of the natural world is a source of not only great curiosity, but great fulfillment.
quotes.meaning: Nature study provides intellectual and emotional satisfaction.

quotes.author: Ernst Haeckel
quotes.quote: Ontogeny recapitulates phylogeny.

quotes.author: Gregor Mendel
quotes.quote: My scientific work has brought me a great deal of satisfaction.

quotes.author: Thomas Hunt Morgan
quotes.quote: The egg has a polarity which is the polarity of the future individual.

quotes.author: Hermann Muller
quotes.quote: The gene is the basis of life.

quotes.author: George Beadle
quotes.quote: One gene, one enzyme.

quotes.author: Sewall Wright
quotes.quote: Genetic drift is evolution without natural selection.

quotes.author: Ronald Fisher
quotes.quote: Natural selection is a mechanism for generating an exceedingly high degree of improbability.

quotes.author: J.B.S. Haldane
quotes.quote: The Universe is not only queerer than we suppose, but queerer than we can suppose.

quotes.author: Julian Huxley
quotes.quote: Man is the only creature that refuses to be what he is.

quotes.author: Waddington
quotes.quote: The epigenetic landscape shows the paths of development.

quotes.author: Hans Spemann
quotes.quote: The organizer determines the fate of neighboring cells.

quotes.author: Barbara McClintock
quotes.quote: I know my corn plants intimately, and I find it a great pleasure to know them.
quotes.meaning: Deep familiarity with research subjects brings joy.

quotes.author: Sydney Brenner
quotes.quote: Progress in science depends on new techniques, new discoveries and new ideas, probably in that order.
quotes.meaning: Methodology enables empirical and conceptual advances.

quotes.author: François Jacob
quotes.quote: Evolution is tinkering, not engineering.
quotes.meaning: Natural selection modifies existing structures rather than designing optimally.

quotes.author: Jacques Monod
quotes.quote: Chance and necessity are the two pillars of evolution.
quotes.meaning: Random mutation and selective constraint drive change.

quotes.author: Max Delbrück
quotes.quote: A mature scientist must have the courage of his ignorance.

quotes.author: Salvador Luria
quotes.quote: Science is not a sacred cow, but it's a beautiful thing.

quotes.author: Joshua Lederberg
quotes.quote: Bacteria were here before we were, and will be here after we're gone.

quotes.author: Barbara Stocking
quotes.quote: Science is not finished until it is communicated.

quotes.author: Aristotle
quotes.quote: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.

quotes.author: Plato
quotes.quote: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself.

quotes.author: Socrates
quotes.quote: I know that I know nothing.

quotes.author: Heraclitus
quotes.quote: Character is destiny.

quotes.author: Democritus
quotes.quote: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.

quotes.author: Epicurus
quotes.quote: Not what we have, but what we enjoy, constitutes our abundance.

quotes.author: Zeno of Elea
quotes.quote: Motion is impossible.

quotes.author: Thales
quotes.quote: Water is the principle of all things.

quotes.author: Anaximander
quotes.quote: The infinite is the principle of all things.

quotes.author: Anaximenes
quotes.quote: Air is the primary substance.

quotes.author: Xenophanes
quotes.quote: If oxen and horses had hands, they would draw gods in their own image.

quotes.author: Empedocles
quotes.quote: God is a circle whose center is everywhere and circumference nowhere.
quotes.meaning: Divine presence is omnipresent and infinite.

quotes.author: Anaxagoras
quotes.quote: Mind ordered the universe.

quotes.author: Protagoras
quotes.quote: Man is the measure of all things.

quotes.author: Gorgias
quotes.quote: Nothing exists; if it did, we couldn't know it; if we knew it, we couldn't communicate it.
quotes.meaning: Radical skepticism about existence and knowledge.

quotes.author: Diogenes
quotes.quote: I am looking for an honest man.

quotes.author: Antisthenes
quotes.quote: The most useful piece of learning for the uses of life is to unlearn what is untrue.

quotes.author: Crates
quotes.quote: Poverty is the philosopher's teacher.

quotes.author: Pyrrho
quotes.quote: Nothing can be known with certainty.

quotes.author: Chrysippus
quotes.quote: Vice is ignorance; virtue is knowledge.
quotes.meaning: Moral failure stems from lack of understanding.
